metadata.title: Echorer Kaliya | এঁচোড়ের কালিয়া | Bengali Recipe
metadata.description:
Echorer Kaliya by Rita Mondal I রুরাল রেসিপির অষ্টম পর্ব । পূর্ব বর্ধমানের বননবগ্রামের বাসিন্দা শ্রীমতি রীতা মন্ডলের হাতের রান্না :  এঁচোড়ের কালিয়া ।

As summer approaches, this vegetarian dish emerges as a favorite among the masses, renowned for its delectable flavor that rivals even mutton curry. In the past, nearly every household boasted mango and jackfruit trees, ensuring easy access to unripe jackfruits, known as echor.  Mastering the art of cutting echor is crucial to its preparation, a skill passed down through generations of women in traditional households.  Sadly, this valuable culinary tradition is fading amidst the fast-paced urban lifestyle of today.

Rural local recipes are integral part of Intangible Cultural Heritage and needs to be preserved and promoted. We at banglanatak dot com have been working for the past 22+ years to safeguard and promote local cultural heritages in rural spaces across India. We are now launching a new initiative of documenting rural recipes and bringing them closer to the food lovers of the world. We request all to subscribe to our new channel Rural Recipes and stay tuned there to know, learn and try out local delicacies.

transcription_bengali: [00:00:12] আজ আমরা রান্না করব এঁচোড়—একটা ঐতিহ্যবাহী পদ (এটাকে কোথাও কোথাও ‘গাছ পাতা’ নামেও বলা হয়)।
[00:00:51] এটা গোটা জিরে আর শুকনো লঙ্কা।
[00:01:11] কুচানো পেঁয়াজ, কাঁচা লঙ্কা, আদা আর রসুন।
[00:01:21] আমি বললাম আমি এঁচোড় কাটাটা শুট করব,
[00:01:31] কিন্তু বাজারের কাটাটা ঠিকঠাক হয় না।
[00:01:35] আমার মায়ের বাড়িতে এঁচোড় কাটার একটা আলাদা পদ্ধতি আছে।
[00:07:00] না, আমি অ্যাডভেঞ্চার কমেডি করতে ভালোবাসি।
[00:08:56] আর এটা রান্না করাও খুব সহজ।
[00:09:00] বর্ষাকালের জন্য এই পদগুলো খুব কাজে লাগে।
[00:09:12] ভিডিওটা ভালো লাগলে লাইক, শেয়ার আর সাবস্ক্রাইব করুন।
transcription_english: [00:00:12] Today we’re going to cook echor (unripe jackfruit), a traditional dish (also known in some places as “gach pata”).
[00:00:26] Rita is going to cook echor today.
[00:00:31] Rita, what are we going to cook with echor?
[00:00:37] Today we’re going to learn Echorer Kaliya.
[00:00:51] This is whole cumin and dry red chili.
[00:01:11] Chopped onions, green chilies, ginger, and garlic.
[00:01:21] I told her I would shoot the echor cutting,
[00:01:24] because cutting echor is very difficult.
[00:01:28] These days you can buy echor from the market,
[00:01:31] but people in the market don’t cut it properly.
[00:01:35] My mother has a special method for cutting echor at home.
[00:01:38] Today we will learn that method.
[00:02:14] Why are you throwing these away?
[00:02:36] I will put it into boiling water.
[00:03:09] I will fry them until they turn slightly reddish.
[00:03:56] I will add garlic and chilies.
[00:04:03] I will add whole garam masala.
[00:04:30] I have added ginger, garlic, coriander, and cumin,
[00:04:54] I will add some more water.
[00:05:00] There are two types of chili powder.
[00:05:04] the other is hot red chili powder.
[00:05:25] Now I will add the potatoes and echor.
[00:06:02] I will add a little sugar.
[00:06:33] I will cover it and let it cook.
[00:06:43] What do you like to do?
[00:06:44] What do you like to do?
[00:06:45] You don’t have to tell me.
[00:06:48] What do you want to do?
[00:06:56] What kind of comedy do you like?
[00:08:21] It has a very nice aroma.
[00:08:52] Rita has made a very nice Echorer Kaliya.
[00:08:56] And it is very easy to cook.
[00:09:00] These dishes are especially useful in the rainy season.
[00:09:12] If you like this video, please like, share, and subscribe to the channel.
